results.title: A Pace ahead
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Australian Dairy Board
results.brief_description: Research is the basis for new and improved products from the dairy industry. Experimental farms test new breeds of cattle, pastures and fodder harvesting and conservation. Shows milk production, butter making, cheese making, and the by-products of casein and malt, and considers the nearby eastern countries as a tremendous market.

results.title: Our friends, why?
results.creator_credit: R. Dudfield, J. Biss and Brighton Grammar School (Vic.). Film Makers Club
results.brief_description: The story revolves around two brothers, their friends and a broken kite. When the friends find out they have been hoaxed by the brothers, there is a rumpus, but finally all shake hands and are friends again. (Award: Best film of all categories at the 1963 Milan International Festival for Young Film Makers)

results.title: Listen to a city
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Andrew J. Helgeson and Cinesound
results.brief_description: A sophisticated view of Melbourne taking in its gardens, shops, theatres, restaurants, nightclubs and discotheques. Sporting activities include a race meeting, a football match, and water sports. Highlights Melbourne’s annual Moombe Festival and includes scenes at Montsalvat.

results.title: Life is More Pleasant with Wine
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents the joys of drinking wine, a harmonious accompaniment to many activities. Suggests times, places and accompaniments for wine; discusses the qualities and features of each type of wine, the type of glass required; and how best to serve it.

results.title: Late again
results.creator_credit: Brighton Grammar School (Vic.). Film Makers Club
results.brief_description: A good example of school film making. The boys are late to school again, the master waits with a cane. The attempt to overcome their problems causes the downfall of the master’s wife.
results.description: A good example of school film making. The boys are late to school again, the master waits with a cane. The attempt to overcome their problems causes the downfall of the master’s wife.

results.title: [Lasker and Lasker Surf Outfitters: bathing suits and caps: advertisement]
results.brief_description: Promotes Lasker and Lasker Surf Outfitters of 402 and 404 George St, Sydney, N.S.W. Women and men model bathing suits and caps on a beach. Shots include the models standing next to a surf boat, models with parasols, and a model putting on a beach coat. (Cinema advertisement, includes intertitles).

results.title: Is it always right to be right?
results.creator_credit: Lee Mishkin, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: This fast moving parable, designed to provoke discussion without alienating any group, highlights the centres of divisiveness in our society, the generation gap, poverty, war and race. It tells of a land “where men were always right”. This animated film is a winner of many awards including an Academy Award. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: Indonesia: an Alternative Lifestyle
results.creator_credit: Leigh Tilson and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film that contrasts behind-the-scenes life in both rural and urban Indonesia with the view of the country as seen by foreign tourists.

results.title: In the Wake of the Stars
results.creator_credit: Walter Batty, Mark McDonald, Bede Whiteman and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Aviation came quickly in Australia. In the early days reliable DC3’s carried everyone and everything. Then new faster and more comfortable aircraft were sought: the Fokker Friendship from Holland, the super Viscount from France and turbo jets from America. During training flights the attractions of gracious Amsterdam, gay Paris, England’s spring, New York’s people, Rome’s buildings and Australia’s scenic attractions are presented.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walter Batty, Mark McDonald, Bede Whiteman and Cinesound

results.title: In partnership with the people
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Battery Point is one of the oldest parts of Hobart and the City Council is about to put into practice a development plan which will retain the character and charm of this area. Shows the signal station, the seamen’s cottages, the fine houses of the wealthy, Kelly’s Steps, St George’s Church and other historic items.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John M. Bale and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
